hotspots.label: Flower Bud
hotspots.fact: This flower bud is part of the plant's life cycle—it will soon open into a beautiful flower! The bud is like a protective package that keeps the delicate flower parts safe until they're ready to bloom. This is called a **bud** — that's a small bump on a plant that grows into a flower, leaf, or branch.

vocabulary.definition: A small bump on a plant that grows and develops into a flower, leaf, or new branch.

hotspots.label: Green Stem
hotspots.fact: The green stem holds up the flower bud and carries water and nutrients from the roots to help the plant grow strong and healthy. Without a strong stem, the flower wouldn't be able to reach sunlight! The stem is like the plant's skeleton—it provides **support** to keep all the plant parts standing tall.

vocabulary.definition: The main green part of a plant that holds up the leaves and flowers and carries water from the roots.

hotspots.label: Plant Growth
hotspots.fact: This young plant is growing and developing, which is an important part of its life cycle. Plants need sunlight, water, and nutrients from soil to grow bigger and stronger each day. Living things like plants grow throughout their lives, changing size and shape as time passes—this is called **growth**.

vocabulary.definition: The process of getting bigger and developing over time as a living thing gets older.

hotspots.label: Seed Pod Below Bud
hotspots.fact: This small brown part at the bottom is where seeds will develop after the flower is pollinated and bloomed. Seeds are how plants make babies and spread to new places in nature! A **seed** is a tiny package that contains a baby plant inside and has everything it needs to grow into a new plant.

vocabulary.definition: A tiny object made by a plant that can grow into a new plant when it has water, soil, and sunlight.
